benchmark_details.name: Object Recognition in Incongruous Context Benchmark (ORIC)
benchmark_details.overview: ORIC evaluates Large Vision-Language Models (LVLMs) on their performance in recognizing objects under contextual incongruity, where deviations from expected object-context relationships lead to misidentification and hallucinations.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To systematically analyze the impact of contextual incongruity on the performance of Large Vision-Language Models (LVLMs) in recognizing objects.

data.annotation: Human annotation with a low error rate of 2%

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated as standard binary classification performance metrics.
methodology.interpretation: Higher values of precision, recall, and F1 Score indicate better performance in recognizing objects under contextual incongruity.
methodology.validation: Evaluation of LVLMs across a range of prompts and testing conditions to ensure robustness.
